issue.title: [Python] Minimal ExecPlan bindings to perform Table joins in pyarrow
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-14292](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14292). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
At the moment pyarrow doesn't provide any way to leverage the query execution engine that the C++ layer provides. The goal is to allow a minimal implementation (unexposed to end users) that permits to create an exec plan with multiple inputs and that produces a single output. In between. It should allow to inject as intermediate steps one of the nodes to perform data manipulation.
